page.title: 17FARMING NEAR NEWTON.
page.content: Until 2 years ago this estate land was tenanted by 4 farmers.At next Lady Day only 2 will remain for a large farming company is taking over.The 2 remaining tenants are near retirement and then their land also will go to the company.The change is making a large complex of farm buildings in the centre of Newton redundant for farming purposes.What will happen to it is a cause of concern to Newton villagers. The company is highly mechanised and concerned largely with arable farming, growing crops such as wheat,barley and rape.It does have a large sheep flock which is still sometimes pastured on the former village sheepwalk.The smaller farmers tend to concentrate on fattening cattle and have little arable land.
